abstract: Authorities say young Scottish woman Aqsa Mahmood, who went to Syria in 2013, is one of most active recruiters of young British women to join Islamic State; they are investigating possible links between her and disappearance of three teenage girls from London, who are thought to have gone to Syria to join ISIS; about 100 British women are among 550 Western women thought to have joined Islamist groups in Syria and Iraq.
lead_paragraph: Aqsa Mahmood, who went to Syria in 2013 and is seen as a jihadist recruiter, may be linked to three girls from London who are believed to be enlisting.

headline.main: Teenage Girl Leaves for ISIS, and Others Follow
headline.print_headline: Teenage Girl Leaves for ISIS, and Others Follow

snippet: Aqsa Mahmood, who went to Syria in 2013 and is seen as a jihadist recruiter, may be linked to three girls from London who are believed to be enlisting.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
